New Records: Pakistan surpassed Ireland's previous Cricket World Cup record of chasing 329 to beat England in 2011
Key Match Events: Mohammad Rizwan scored an unbeaten 131 off 121 balls
Kusal Mendis (122 off 77) and Sadeera Samarawickrama (108 off 89) both notched their maiden ODI centuries
Reece Topley returned figures of 4-43 for England
Pre-Game Insights: Sri Lanka has had plenty of bowling problems at the World Cup in the absence of injured star leg spinner Wanindu Hasaranga
Ben Stokes made headlines when he came out of ODI retirement, but he is yet to play a match at the World Cup
Post-Match Reflections: Captain Dasun Shanaka said the team'should have finished stronger', which might have secured its first win of the World Cup
Mohammad Rizwan said after a knock that featured eight fours and three sixes that 'Always proud when you perform like that'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Pakistan stretched its World Cup record against Sri Lanka to 8-0
England captain made headlines when he announced he was coming out of limited-overs retirement for the World Cup but has missed the first two games over injury concerns
The 50-over one-day Cricket World Cup is taking place in India, with Australia looking to add to its record five titles
